results.adx_keywords: Constitutional Amendments;Fourteenth Amendment (US Constitution);Constitution (US);Supreme Court (US)
results.title: Did the Supreme Court Open the Door to Reviving One of Its Worst Decisions?
results.abstract: Lochner v. New York, a 1905 decision on labor law, is imprinted on today’s law students as an example of bad jurisprudence. But those old days could be returning.

media.caption: Some of the current justices of the Supreme Court seem inclined toward a renewed deference to the moribund notion of freedom of contract.
media.copyright: T.J. Kirkpatrick for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Hydroxychloroquine (Drug);Zelenko, Vladimir;Kiryas Joel (NY)
results.title: Vladimir Zelenko, 48, Dies; Promoted an Unfounded Covid Treatment
results.abstract: A self-described “simple country doctor,” he won national attention in 2020 when the White House embraced his hydroxychloroquine regimen.

media.caption: Dr. Vladimir Zelenko near his office in upstate New York in March 2020, shortly after he posted a video promoting hydroxychloroquine as a treatment for Covid-19. He claimed a 100 percent success rate.
media.copyright: Bryan Derballa for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Food Contamination and Poisoning;Listeriosis;Ice Cream and Frozen Desserts;Deaths (Fatalities);Big Olaf Creamery;Florida;Sarasota (Fla)
results.title: Listeria Outbreak Is Linked to Ice Cream, C.D.C. Says
results.abstract: Big Olaf Ice Cream products, which are made in Florida, have sickened people across 10 states, the federal authorities said.

media.caption: A Listeria monocytogenes bacterium. An outbreak of listeria across 10 states has been tied to a Florida ice cream maker, officials said.
media.copyright: Elizabeth White/Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, via Associated Press

results.title: Man Dies After Truck Propelled by Jet Engines Crashes at Michigan Air Show
results.abstract: The vehicle, called a Shockwave Jet Truck, was racing two planes when it crashed, killing the driver, officials said.

media.caption: A truck powered by jet engines, which was racing two planes at an air show in Battle Creek, Mich., crashed on Saturday, killing the driver.
media.copyright: WWMT

results.adx_keywords: Abortion;Birth Control and Family Planning;Supreme Courts (State);Law and Legislation;Texas
results.title: Texas Supreme Court Lifts Freeze on Abortion Ban
results.abstract: The decision, overturning a lower court ruling that had temporarily blocked the ban, allowed a 1925 law to take effect.

media.caption: The Whole Woman’s Health Clinic in McAllen, Texas. A state Supreme Court ruling allowed a 1925 abortion ban to take effect, though legal arguments on the issue will continue later this month.
media.copyright: Verónica G. Cárdenas for The New York Times

results.title: ‘The Pro-Life Generation’: Young Women Fight Against Abortion Rights
results.abstract: Many American women mourned the Supreme Court decision to overturn Roe, but for others it is a moment of triumph and a matter of human rights.
des_facet: Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision)

media.caption: Kristin Turner, the communications director for Progressive Anti-Abortion Uprising. Some relative newcomers to the anti-abortion movement include young women whose activism is not connected to religious belief.
media.copyright: Rachel Bujalski for The New York Times

results.title: How Delta-8 THC Works — and Why Experts Are Worried About It
results.abstract: This popular cannabis product claims to be milder than regular marijuana. But is it legal? And is it safe?

results.adx_keywords: Masks;Workplace Hazards and Violations;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Protective Clothing and Gear;Hospitals;Shortages;Factories and Manufacturing;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health
results.title: A Clunky Mask May Be the Answer to Airborne Disease and N95 Waste
results.abstract: Experts say the U.S. government has unintentionally encouraged a dependency on imported masks by failing to promote elastomeric respirators, a reusable mask that is domestically produced.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health

media.caption: Three years into the pandemic, elastomeric respirators — industrial-grade face masks familiar to car painters and construction workers — remain a rarity at U.S. health care facilities.
media.copyright: Kirsten Luce for The New York Times

results.title: New Dementia Prevention Method May Be Behavioral, Not Prescribed
results.abstract: As experimental drugs prove ineffective against increasing dementia cases in the U.S., researchers argue that improving eyesight can have an effect.

media.caption: In a recent study, researchers estimated that healthy vision could have prevented about 100,000 dementia cases.

results.title: A Mother and Her 3 Children Are Found Dead in a Minnesota Lake

results.title: 3 Dead in Copenhagen Mall Shooting, Police Say
results.abstract: The police said that one person was in custody but that it was too early to suggest a motive for the shooting, which happened at the Field’s shopping center on Sunday.

media.caption: Terrified shoppers fled for safety after a gunman opened fire at a mall in Copenhagen on Sunday, leaving three people dead and at least three others critically wounded.

results.title: 76 Fake Charities Shared a Mailbox. The I.R.S. Approved Them All.

results.title: Searching for Gold, Miners Discover a Frozen Baby Mammoth
results.abstract: Experts believe that the woolly mammoth, unearthed in the Klondike gold fields of the Yukon of Canada, had been preserved in the frozen ground for more than 30,000 years.

media.caption: A worker for a mining company in the Yukon made an important discovery while digging in the permafrost: the remarkably well-preserved body of a baby woolly mammoth.
media.copyright: Treadstone Equipment

results.title: Once a Crucial Refuge, ‘Gayborhoods’ Lose L.G.B.T.Q. Residents in Major Cities
results.abstract: Many are choosing to live elsewhere in search of cheaper housing and better amenities. They are finding growing acceptance in other communities after decades of political and social changes.

results.title: As City Falls, Ukraine’s Last Hope in Luhansk Falls With It
